private_information: I am allowed to move disks A, B, C, D, E.
I can only move a disk if it is the top disk of a peg.
I cannot place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
agent_1.goal: Contribute to achieving the global arrangement: left peg (top→bottom) D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg (top→bottom) A; right peg (top→bottom) B, C. Provide the sequence of primitive moves you will perform (if any).

private_information: I am allowed to move disks F, G, H, I, J.
I can only move a disk if it is the top disk of a peg.
I cannot place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
agent_2.goal: Contribute to achieving the global arrangement. If no moves are required by my allowed disks, indicate an empty move list.

private_information: I am allowed to move disks K, L, M, N, O.
I can only move a disk if it is the top disk of a peg.
I cannot place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
agent_3.goal: Contribute to achieving the global arrangement. If no moves are required by my allowed disks, indicate an empty move list.

private_information: I coordinate agent move proposals and produce the final PDDL domain and problem for the FastDownwards solver.
I must keep each agent's actions distinct when integrating their proposals.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate agent proposals into a single correct plan and produce a PDDL domain and problem (targeting the FastDownwards solver) that represent the task and the final move sequence.

public_information: There are 3 pegs: left, middle, right.
There are 15 disks labeled from smallest to largest: A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O (A smallest, O largest).
Initial configuration (top→bottom) on left peg: A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O. Middle and right pegs are empty.
Goal configuration: left peg (top→bottom) D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg (top→bottom) A; right peg (top→bottom) B, C.
Tower of Hanoi rules apply: only the top disk of any peg may be moved; a larger disk may never be placed on a smaller disk.
Agents are restricted by which disk labels they are allowed to move: agent_1 ⇒ A, B, C, D, E; agent_2 ⇒ F, G, H, I, J; agent_3 ⇒ K, L, M, N, O.

plan.system_prompt: You are agent_1 in the multi-agent Tower of Hanoi instance. Do not emit PDDL. Instead, given your private information and the public problem statement, produce the ordered list of primitive moves you will perform. Use the exact primitive move format: 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Only include moves for disks you are allowed to move (A, B, C, D, E). Ensure every move respects the Tower of Hanoi rules (only top disk can move; never place larger on smaller). If you will make no moves, return an empty list.

You are agent_2 in the multi-agent Tower of Hanoi instance. Do not emit PDDL. Based on your allowed disks (F, G, H, I, J) and the public problem statement, indicate the ordered list of primitive moves you will perform, using the exact format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. If you will make no moves, return an empty list.

You are agent_3 in the multi-agent Tower of Hanoi instance. Do not emit PDDL. Based on your allowed disks (K, L, M, N, O) and the public problem statement, indicate the ordered list of primitive moves you will perform, using the exact format 'agent_3: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. If you will make no moves, return an empty list.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert orchestrator producing a PDDL domain and problem suitable to be solved with the FastDownwards solver (FastDownwards / FastDownward family). You must integrate the agents' proposed primitive-move lists into a consistent multi-agent model. Keep each agent's actions distinct (prefix actions or predicates with agent identifiers as needed). Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that represent the initial state, goals, and allowed actions, and that encode which agent can move which disk. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Target the FastDownwards solver conventions in your domain/problem (standard STRIPS/PDDL requirements where applicable).

final_move_sequence: agent_1: move disk A from left to right
agent_1: move disk B from left to middle
agent_1: move disk A from right to middle
agent_1: move disk C from left to right
agent_1: move disk A from middle to left
agent_1: move disk B from middle to right
agent_1: move disk A from left to middle
